title: What are some examples of Renaissance women? - Quora

response.answer_text: Émilie , Marquise du Châtelet is one. She was a natural philosopher (the early term for scientist), mathematician, physicist and writer in 18th Century France. She translated Newton into French with commentary, wrote a treatise on Physics, was cited heavily in Diderot’s Encyclopédie. She was also the lover of Voltaire. Unfortunately, she died in childbirth at 42. Émilie du Châtelet - Wikipedia Another is Ada, Countess Lovelace, daughter of Lord Byron. She was a mathematician, scientist, writer and one of the leading intellects of her age. She worked with Charles Babbage, who invented the ‘Analytical Engine’ - basically the first computer. It was she who first saw applications for the Engine more elaborate than just doing mathematical computations — she even envisioned it writing music. She came up with algorithms to tell the machine what to do; in essence, she invented computer programming. She considered her approach to be “poetical science.” Ada Lovelace - Wikipedia And of course, perhaps the most obvious example of a literal “Renaissance Woman” was Elizabeth I of England. She was an astute politician, an inspiring leader, and Supreme Governor of the English protestant church. She spoke 9 languages and could also read and write Latin and Greek. She presided over a Golden Age of English art and literature. Elizabeth I of England - Wikipedia Lovely question. Thanks for the A2A.

Juana Inés de la Cruz is a possible example. She lived in 17th century Mexico and was a scientist, philosopher, composer, and poet. She publicly criticized the misogyny that was widespread at the time and worked on helping the poor. Juana Inés de la Cruz - Wikipedia
